author: n3tsurge
description: This capability involves establishing the ability to find processes by their hash values. This includes implementing mechanisms to compute and store hash values for processes, enabling quick identification and verification of process integrity. It is essential for incident response, malware analysis, and system monitoring, providing a means to detect unauthorized or malicious processes based on their unique hash signatures.

requirements.description: Staff must be trained and qualified to perform this capability effectively.
Documented procedures and playbooks must be available for executing this capability.

title: Establish Ability to Find Processes by Hash

references.name: NIST SP 800-137: Information Security Continuous Monitoring (ISCM)
MITRE ATT&CK: Discovery Tactics and Detection Strategies
CISA Zero Trust Architecture - Monitoring and Analytics
